snippet: A compromise gives the United States and Pakistan a chance to arrest a downward spiral in their troubled and mutually dependent relationship.
abstract: Editorial welcomes a compromise agreement between the United States and Pakistan that gives the two countries a chance to arrest the downward spiral in their troubled relationship; observes that while the agreement benefits both countries and will allow the US to reopen supply routes for its forces in Afghanistan, the deal alone will not ensure a fast turnaround in relations filled with mistrust.
lead_paragraph: A compromise gives the United States and Pakistan a chance to arrest a downward spiral in their troubled and mutually dependent relationship.

headline.seo: Détente on Supply Routes to Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
